title: FLCL: Shoegaze
content:
It’s crazy how FLCL went from the forgotten dusted-up masterclass of a shoe to one with way too many half-baked spin-offs that do nothing but harm the public image of the franchise. To begin with, it’s crazy enough to call it a franchise now. I guess you must sign along with me during this review.

Shoegaze is a sequel to the Alternative spin-off of the original 2000s show, specifically 10 years later, and unfortunately, just as disappointing and pale.

If guess, the first criticism any other sequel gets is that it diverts away from the premise of the previous installment and dulls everything out if not mostif it, however, to Shoegaze’s defense, it kept up with the disappointment that was Alternative, and even added zero flavoring on top of it, it’s like the makers said: “we here you, here’s more of what we gave you”.

It feels like a missed opportunity for Shoegaze to not capitalize on the “coming of age” plot line that FLCL and its disappointing spin-offs always aimed for, but instead, did a half-half approach with a minimal teenage focus and an adult focus, both diverging in a literal pot of doo-doo.

If I did not love the original FLCL show I wouldn’t have been as passionate in my hating towards Shoegaze, but to be honest, you gotta vent sometimes.

Overall: 5.18/10.
